thread.title: Stocks lower as Fed minutes keep rate increase in play
thread.title_full: Stocks lower as Fed minutes keep rate increase in play - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Stocks lower as Fed minutes keep rate increase in play
text:
By KEN SWEET
AP Business Writer NEW YORK (AP) - U.S. stocks are closing down as investors react to mixed signals from the Federal Reserve that an interest rate hike in September was still being debated.
The Dow Jones industrial average fell 162 points, or 0.9 percent, to end at 17,349 Wednesday. The Standard & Poor's 500 index lost 17 points, or 0.8 percent, to 2,080 and the Nasdaq composite fell 40 points, or 0.8 percent, to 5,019.
Energy stocks fell as the price of oil plummeted.
In the minutes from the Federal Reserve's July meeting, Fed officials appeared to move closer to raising interest rates for the first time in nearly a decade but were concerned about the risks of a significant economic slowdown in China to the U.S.
